channel.title: MakeHitMusic song ripper
channel.description:
My uncle decided he wanted a few instrumental songs, and he found like 10 on here he liked. After sorting through 100's of lines I found the line that deals with playing the song. I simply made this application read the entire document for that line, filter out the link, replace necessary things, and download. You will need .Net as this is written in C#, I am currently writing a form of this in Java, I just wanted to make sure I had the write methods in my head first.
How to use:
[ul][li]Goto: http://www.makehitmusic.com/ and pick out a song, and go to its page (link will look like http://www.makehitmusic.com/goin_crazy)[/li] [li]Copy and paste the link into the textbox on the MakeHitMusic ripper[/li] [li]Hit Download[/li] [li]When prompt, save the file[/li][/ul]
Known Bug:
[ul][li][s]Program wont load a 2nd song, must close and re-open, not sure whats causing it.[/s] - Solved[/li][/ul]
Screenshot: [img]http://true-programas.netii.net/images/1293179525.png[/img]
Scan: (antivirus didnt show full name anyways -.-) [img]http://true-programas.netii.net/images/1293063188.png[/img]
Download: http://uppit.com/hdp9fo86ddtp/MakeHitMusic_Ripper.exe
EDIT - I think I might be the first person to release a tool to do this from that site. I'm trying to use google and can't find anything.

item.title: MakeHitMusic song ripper
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:10, topic:374450”][quote author=pure2ownage link=topic=470425.msg3442021#msg3442021 date=1293143829]

Try converting it into a web page.

Not entirely sure what you mean. A for example, PHP script to do this?
[/quote]yeah.

I’ll see what I can do, but I am having issues with getting the Java version to load the page links. Throws a “file not found” error, although it works fine with ‘http://www.google.com’ and with ‘http://makehitmusic.com’, just not with direct links to songs lol.[/quote]Could do some testing on PHP for you.

Read full topic
